data.text: @inthebubblepod @ASlavitt Are there transcripts of these available to read?

@inthebubblepod @ASlavitt Well, in my working class, mostly poc neighborhood in Chicago, people aren't thinking it's over even if the powers that be try darnest to have people believe, behave that way. Mask mandate ended 2 weeks ago in IL, 99% still masking in my local grocery store. Issue is crappy masks
@inthebubblepod @ASlavitt Heâ€™s too good to be true. We are so lucky we have him.
@inthebubblepod @ASlavitt Tell that to Hong Kong and see how they react!

@inthebubblepod @ASlavitt Interesting perspective: Pandemics are over when the people decide they're over, and we're at that point now. I don't get the sense there's a value judgement there; it's just inherent in human nature to want to move on, even though the disease is still with us.
@inthebubblepod @ASlavitt Fascinating conversation. There was so much I didn't know about the early history and epidemiology of AIDS and how it relates to today. Thank you
